page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY BARGOED AREA
page.content: CAPEL GWLADYS The earliest church buildings at CAPEL GWLADYS were probably built on old pagan sites. The site of the chapel was discovered in 1906. A low stone wall, 30cms high, was built around the perimeter forming rectangle 13.5m. by 7.2m. Eventually, the remains of a circular wall were detected around the site at a distance of 24m. from it. These circular wall traces show that the area had been a sacred enclosure of importance in the past. PONT CARADOG Caradog exists in Celtic song/legend. PONT CARADOG commemorates his name. Although the original bridge has collapsed, the stone used still exists. The site was really an 11th century pack-horse bridge (an ancient Silurian and Roman ford crossing the River Darren).
